column1: 2D795F6A-57A7-4C69-BF14-3794BB3517E8#appfire#86092158-2D71-4D13-9621-6F376F48CA5E#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-02-01 17:03:06.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-02-01 17:03:06.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#5067B457-10FD-496D-816A-598CE19D8B0C#appfire#86092158-2D71-4D13-9621-6F376F48CA5E#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-02-01 17:03:06.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-02-01 17:03:06.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#72870D65-7FF8-429D-8BE3-E6D190315F6C#appfire#86092158-2D71-4D13-9621-6F376F48CA5E#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-02-01 17:03:06.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-02-01 17:03:06.0#appfire#1
